text: Dominick John Dunne (October 29, 1925 - August 26, 2009) was an American activist, journalist, writer, and actor. He talked about crimes, scandals, or mysteries in his books or his own television show Dominick Dunne's Power, Privilege, and Justice. ==Biography== ===Early and personal life=== Dunne was born on October 29, 1925 in Hartford, Connecticut. He studied at Kingswood School, Canterbury School, and Williams College. His brother was writer John Gregory Dunne (1932-2003). Dunne was married to Ellen Beatriz Griffin from 1954 until they divorced in 1965. Dunne had two sons, actor Griffin (born 1955) and Alexander (born 1957). His daughter was actress Dominique Dunne (1959-1982). ===Death=== Dunne died on August 26, 2009 in Manhattan, New York from bladder cancer, aged 83.Dominick Dunne, Chronicler of Crime, Dies at 83, The New York Times, August 26, 2009 ==Movies== *The Boys in the Band *The Panic in Needle Park *Play It as It Lays *Ash Wednesday *Dominick Dunne's Power, Privilege, and Justice ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1925 births Category:2009 deaths Category:Actors from Hartford, Connecticut Category:American activists Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:Cancer deaths in New York City Category:Deaths from bladder cancer Category:Journalists from Connecticut Category:Writers from Hartford, Connecticut
title: Dominick Dunne
